Articles.Content: I tried installing Dark Multiplayer on my Linux box. I got it working, but was unable to join any servers, and then my game saves got corrupted. I deleted the DMP files, removed the local content, & reinstalled the game, but now it won't load. I get a few minutes of black screen when I try to start it, then I'm back at the Steam menu. I've "verified" my files, & reinstalled several times after making sure the game folders were deleted. Any ideas?
Hi CrowT, we really need your log files before we can figure this out, please see the stickies at the top of this forum section, thanks

Code tags are such wonderful things

Looks like the graphics driver? It's failing with the shaders, have you updated and not rebooted?
It was working before I installed DMP. I'm a Linux noob, I'll try updating & rebooting but I don't know how to update the graphics driver.
What distro and graphics card are you using?

Firstly, do you have working OpenGL?

output of:

glxinfo | grep 'direct\ rendering\| renderer \|OpenGL\ vendor\ string'

direct rendering: Yes

OpenGL vendor string: X.Org

OpenGL renderer string: Gallium 0.4 on AMD RV770

I did manage to install the driver a while back; I have a Radeon HD4850 which isn't supported any more, but KSP was working fine until I tried installing DMP.

- - - Updated - - -

I'm using Crunchbang Linux.

Has anyone had any luck getting their Logitech Extreme 3D Joystick to work on Ubuntu and KSP .25? I've looked all over and can't find any solid infor on drivers or if it's even possible. Thanks. Oh and is there a universal Linux support thread for everyone thats not locked?

The Linux Thread is here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92231-The-Linux-Thread

Now that you know that, please refrain from hijacking other threads with your issue in future, mmkay?

You appear to be running the open source driver, which is now the recommended option.

That said, have you tried AMDs proprietary 'catalyst' drivers?

Last I checked they were buggy as hell, but still outperformed the Xorg / Gallium driver.

I don't have an AMD card though, so will be of limited help.

Note that this may not be an option if you've got Xorg >1.12, thanks AMD.

@brian6712, I have one, it works fine without any special drivers. Debain Sid x86_64.

Edited November 8, 2014 by steve_v
